38390476.review:
Warning: Kinda contains spoilers. They're not bad, but just in case...

[Spoiler]It's not the best shmup ever, but it's cheap and will definitely give you a run for your money, at least on DEATH mode (which you should not go after right away). There are 12 bosses, which definitely differ themselves, a bunch of different abilities to choose from (though you get a reward for getting through most of the game without any besides the default), a lot of mini DDR sections, and some FPS gameplay.[/Spoiler]

The prequel is free, and it's worth your time, so play that first.

38199743.review:
Awesome sequel to an already great game.
Nice music, cute graphics, funny dialogue, a lot of secrets to find, and very replayable. Great if you want something to just pick up and play. 
In a world of special editions, season passes, and day 1 DLCs, a work of love like this is a breath of fresh air. Definitely worth the three dollars.
FrallanXRemedy is my OTP.

38047138.review: Basically more of what occurred in the first game. Bullet hell with a lot of charm for about 2 hours worth of fun.

38023158.review: Short but a fun and memorable experience. Worth the 3 bucks. Very charming. Fun to play. Lots of fun secrets to discover. Multiple difficulty modes. Dating characters grants you different abilities which allow you to change your tactics. The first game was free and equally fun to play. Download that one, enjoy it, then buy the sequel, and enjoy it.

38017004.review:
World of Hurt was already a great arcade-y shooter, but Heap of Trouble improves on it in every way. The bosses are bigger and more fun, the story is sillier, and there's even an awesome surprise gameplay twist at the end. Three bucks for this is one of the best deals on Steam. 

If you haven't played World of Hurt, it's nearly as good and free, so you might as well do that first. If you like it, you'll almost certainly enjoy Heap of Trouble.

37989574.review: É muito bom pode confiar, só compra ele em uma promoção pq o preço e meio salgado pagaria 3 ou 2 R$ no maximo

37729008.review: Princess Remedy 2 is an interesting blend between a single screen top-down shooter and JRPG with graphics heavily reminiscent of old PC games, notably the ZX Spectrum. If you're not sure whether you'll like this game, I'd recommend trying Princess Remedy In A World of Hurt. It's completely free, and in a way could be seen as a demo of this game. In a way. This game is about as long as Princess Remedy 1. It does have a new 'Dating' mechanic which changes your special attack in battle. This can range from a landmine, flasks like in the first game, a short-range laser, and a larger flask. You can date any NPC in the game. The game also adds a little checkmark when you've 100%ed an overworld area, something the first game would have benefited greatly from. My first playthrough on normal took 53 Minutes, and I 100%ed the game thanks to that feature. When you finish the game, you get a little cutscene with the character you were dating at the time of beating the final boss, similar to the first game. The game is fairly challenging, with higher difficulty levels available for those looking for a harder (Or lesser) challenge, though even a fairly casual player should be able to beat the game on Normal without getting angry. The game relies a lot on humor and charm to sell itself, similar to titles such as Earthbound, and while I can't say I think the humor is as solid as in a game like Earthbound, it's still definitely worth checking out. Simply put, try the free game, and if you like it, support the developers by buying the sequel, it's definitely worth it in my opinion, especially at it's very low price point.

37632760.review: Nice fun difficult shoot em up

36745093.review:
If you're on the fence about buying this three dollar game (mad respect for that fiscal responsibility, btw), play its ancestor and it will charm your socks off.

The first game was chock-full of charm and character, with interesting and challenging enemies and mechanics 
(I'm looking at you, jealous chest), but was also short in the best possible way.
It didn't overstay its welcome and when all was said and done it was simply a brief and enjoyable experience.

If you want a second helping of the first game and want to show your support, I can heartily recommend this game to you!

34850171.review:
A short, pleasant and casual game with personality. A compact experience that’s worth supporting the developer for if you enjoyed the first free game.

Very similar to the original with a few improvements:
-New chiptunes!
-More abilities [gameplay variety]
-More Challenging [maybe?]

I really like how something as simple as auto firing and not being able to strafe meanwhile damage heals you creates a disconnect between getting near enemies and running from them. You can get up close with the multi-spread to do damage or sneak in more healing while also risking your current health. If you’re low, you can try to run but, eventually, you’re going to need to run back in to heal.

Also you can date a door, 10/7 Masterpiece :]

This game is essentially the same as the previous game with a well-implemented mechanic that lets you change the function of your bombs. That said, it is still a solid game with tight controls, hilarious dialogue, and a forgiving difficulty curve. My only complaint, perhaps, is that [i]Princess Remedy in a Heap of Trouble[/i] isn't as clever of a pun as [i]Princess Remedy in a World of Hurt[/i].

My suggestion is to play [i]World of Hurt[/i] first (it's free!). If it leaves you craving more, buy [i]Heap of Trouble[/i].

32125761.review:
I was a person who was really charmed by the original Princess Remedy, which is free and a really cute and nice short game to play.  A bullet hell arena-shooter with very minimalistic gameplay that is nothing but adorable to me. 

This sequel basically gives you more of the same, however it does add a little mechanic that makes it a bit more interesting. Basically Remedy is once again ordered to "heal" the world and has to help people out by curing their illnesses. Goal is to save alot of people and upgrade your stats, like health, projectiles you shoot and their strenght. If you aren't helping people you explore the tiny world in search for chests, which also benefit you. 

The previously mentioned mechanic here is that from the beginning on you can have a companion you can date and switch around as much as you like throughout your journey. Depending on which partner you have, they give you different special abilities during battles. Homing Shots, Speedup, Healing, little Traps and so on, its pretty self explainatory. The game is very fun and battles later on can get quite difficult, which i liked quite a bunch. Never in my short gametime did i feel the game being boring and love its cute style.

If you already liked the first, free game i can recommend this game just aswell. Its a nice extra addition, a quick game to play on the side and cheap aswell. But even if you didn't play the first game, i say give it a try!

31924477.review:
There should be more dating sims with shooting elements. I mean look at this - this game is perfect. 
A lovely and really enjoyable sequel. [The prequel is for free btw.]

You can date a whole bunch of fancy characters & "things" offering you different abilities - which is quite fun and provides some kind of different challenge in your healing process [shooting bosses & stuff].

30517624.review: This is an adorable little game is well worth your $3. Everything is so charming from the retro graphics to the awesome soundtrack to the cute and funny NPCs. The game is relatively short but it has quite a bit of replay value if you want experience the game with all the different abilities, get the secret 102% completion rating, and see everyone's dances at the end. The gameplay is a sort of mix between a bullet hell game and a classic NES RPG game. The game works the difficulty up as you progress with challenging boss fights and more enemies in later healing modes. If you want a more challenging experience DEATH mode will definately supply it. There's honestly something here for everyone and it all coalesces into a short burst of fun that can be experienced over and over again. If you're at all a fan of bullet hell games and you want something that's an absolute blast to play through then purchase this game. If you're on the fence about it then try the first game in the series Princess Remedy in a World of Hurt. It's free! If it interests you then definitely consider adding this game to your library, it's worth it!

I love both the Princess Remedy gams so much!

30302308.review: Addicting and fun as hell while it lasts.  Probably an hour long but worth every penny.

30268838.review:
This prequel to the first game, Princess Remedy In A World of Hurt, went above and beyond expectations. Ludosity brings Princess Remedy back with equally compelling music, even more impressive pixel artwork, both additional and improved gameplay mechanics compared to the original, more colorful NPCs (in the sense of their physical color, but colorful in their witty and clever dialogue, too), and is still replete with a multitude of endings to experience. As for the answer to a question which is of great import to many: Yes, it is still quite the romantic game.

P.S. I would also like to point out there is a VERY interesting, yet easily missed, secret unrelated to file completion that is definitely worth checking out if you have the chance (refer to the Secrets thread in the Community Hub).

30209626.review: Pretty chill. You can date a door.

30022542.review:
My friends don't understand why I love the Princess Remedy games so much.
I guess you could say they're the REMEDY to all my sadness. ;DDDD (Sorry not sorry.)

This is the amazing sequel to the already fantastic game, "Princess Remedy in a World of Hurt".
If you haven't played the original game, go play it (it's free) then come back and play this one.
This is kind of like an expansion to the first game, as it's still the same concept.
You run around the land, healing everyone in need by entering these "healing mode" shooter games. You run around, shoot at all the viruses until they die, and then the person is healed!

What's Different About This Game as Compared to the First?
I'm very glad you asked! There is much more land and people to cover, multiple bosses as opposed to just one, and the new dating mechanic, in which you can date and be accompanied by anybody you heal. When you have a special someone following you around, they will give you certain advantages in healing mode. (i.e. Dating Frallan will give you a "healing" move that will heal up a little bit of health.)

Is This Game Better Than the First?
Well, that's a difficult question. In my personal opinion, I think I liked the first game better just because it WAS the first game. Experiencing something as fresh and wonderful as the Princess Remedy franchise for the first time was an amazing experience, and I don't think I'll ever forget those first few moments of wonder. And don't get me wrong, the content and aesthetics of this game are better. I just prefer the first game.

Should I Get This Game?
Play the first game first (if you haven't already), then play this one! It's a fantastic game and is filled with all sorts of humorous bits of dialogue and characters.

Overall, 9.5/10
The only reason I didn't give it a 10/10 is because it's so short. D:
But seriously, please play the Princess Remedy games. It's worth it. I promise.

29869060.review: Fun little game. I might be in the minority in that I preferred In a World of Trouble slightly more, but perhaps whichever one you play first will be your favourite for that initial charm that wins you over.

29737274.review: Just as cute as the first one.

29460475.review:
I usually hate bullet hell styled games but I couldn't help adore the characters and the writing in this one. Most probably I was drawn in by nostalgia to NES styled games as well as its charming soundtrack. If you don't like bullet hells, it's probably not for you. However, if you don't mind them and want to play a charming one hour game, I recommend it. 

£2 in my opinion really isn't that much and the dev poured a lot of their heart and passion into this. This game is definitely the most enjoyable title I've played in a while.

If you're unsure, the first game is free so check that out before committing yourself to buying the 2nd title in the series.

29449876.review:
Итак, начнём с того, что эта часть является приквелом к игре Princess Remedy In a World of Hurt, и принцесса Ремеди только обучается в Школе Лечения, собсна, навыкам лечения. 

Сюжет - 7/10
Насколько я понял, сюжет заключается в том, что вдруг откуда ни возьмись из-под земли выросла Босс Башня (Boss Tower в оригинале), по виду напоминающая дерево, заодно подняв с земли (btw действия игры разворачиваются на Сатурне, лол) все города. Жителям делать нечего - поэтому они и не против особо. Но со временем граждане-обыватели стали замечать, что их народ терроризируют различные болезни, от грусти и печали до вывиха шеи. Помочь всем жителям и, самое главное, Принцу сего Королевства, доверили ученице Сатурнийской школы лечения, принцессе Ремеди. Неплохо.

Геймплей - 7/10
Довольно однообразный bullet hell, но мне нравится :D

Графика - 8.5/10
8-битный графон мне по душе, поэтому за него ментальный лайкос разработчикам.

Музыкальное сопровождение - 7.5/10
В каждой локации она разная, что, в принципе, также не дает нам заскучать. Приятные и не надоедливые мелодии :)

Итог - 7.5/10 свиданий с цветочком!
Отличная игра, чтобы провести за ней часок-другой.

29180894.review: More, more, more of what you liked A World of Hurt for. Short, fun game. Offers as much challenge as you want. The normal mode is easy, beat it in around an hour without rushing. A lot of characters and charm to the game, interesting visual style too. 28643935.review:
Have you ever dreamed of being a doctor, but were turned off when it involved more cellular biology than throwing flasks of questionable liquids at your patients? Have you ever looked in your mirror and thought, "Wow, I'm hot stuff," and wanted to date an exact replica of yourself? Do you frequently like to flaunt that you are a "Princess" on your attire? Then Princess Remedy: In a Heap of Trouble may be for you!

Princess Remedy: In a Heap of Trouble features [b]YOU![/b] [i]The Princess of Saturn.[/i] Everyone in Heal Land gets sick and they need you, a student of the healing arts, to come treat them. Yet school has not only taught you how to heal, but also how to love, and the game features a dating mechanic wherein you can not only mend bodies, but also break hearts. You see, each individual you date gives you a special power, and you can date or dump anybody to give you certain advantages in battle. But, “Wait!” You say, “Isn’t this taking advantage of other people?” Who cares, you're the Princess of Saturn! You're the hottest stuff in the land!

But not only are you charming, but so is the game! It features 8 beautiful bits of glory, complete with mock-NES music. The characters are diverse, and each has unique flavor text whenever you want to use them throughout the game. Furthermore, there are a number of Easter Eggs (during Christmas, no less!), such as the reappearance of a jealous chest and a super-secret mode that you'll have to google to find out. But anyway, I don't want to beat a dead horse because then you'd just have to heal it (and date it too). But this game is a great way to spend an afternoon, and worth every single one of the three dollars which you will spend on it. [b][i]Download today![/i][/b]

28632417.review: Amazing game with an amazing soundtrack that makes you start the game just to listen to the music

28614151.review: I adored the hell out of this. A brilliant example of creating a huge gang of fun little characters with little more than an idea and a nice turn of phrase. Funny and poignant in equal measure, and doesn't wear out its welcome. Highly, highly recommended!

28536134.review: This is one of the most adorable games I've played recently! This is a follow-up to their game jam game "Princess Remedy in A World of Hurt"! It's not a very big game and has some replayability if you like exploring and unlocking achievements, but the battles you engage in in this game can be intense. The aesthetic of the game is strange yet familiar! The characters you end up healing in this game all have hilarious dialogue which mean the team must have had fun coming up with this stuff. In this sequel you can date and break up with every npc you come across which in turn leads to them giving you different powerups and assists during battle. I'd reccomend giving it a try if you're looking for something humorous!

28470830.review:
A very fun and unique game that knows not to take itself seriously, with an interesting battle system that effectively serves as a bullet-hell/top-down shooter. Much of the dialogue is witty and funny, never seeming too quirky or offbeat. 
The soundtrack is done entirely in an 8-bit chiptune style that fits the game's appearance very well, and many of the melodies used for the overworld are pleasant and catchy. 
While the game is short, and can easily be beaten on easy mode in less than 90 minutes, the real bulk comes from the harder difficulties and the crushingly difficult boss battles they bring. Even with their difficulty, the bosses never seem unfair, and you're given all the tools and practice you need to succeed. 
The 8-bit graphics are simple but look cute and fit the theme well, though some of the background tiles are hard to differentiate from interactable objects. This isn't a major issue, though, and barely takes away from the experience at all.
Overall, an extremely enjoyable game that is well worth your time, and is guaranteed to make you smile and laugh at its loveable NPCs and exclaim in victory as you beat overwhelming opponents.

28389253.review:
As a fan of the first game, I can safely say I have enjoyed this sequel. 

The music sounds a bit more in-depth, there's unique music for the bosses of each overworld route, partners you can bring along (on a date), and new special attacks! Even better: [i]these special attacks are interchangable![/i]

While those were nice changes to experience in this retro-like bullet hell, I still have a minor problem with this game: It's really short (20-30 minutes on average per run) just like the first one, and the storyline pretty much mimics the first one: that is, you have to [spoiler]kill a humongous beast made of all the horrifying and problematic troubles in order to save the world[/spoiler], and then [spoiler]choose someone to end your game with[/spoiler]. I personally wish the storyline would have gone a bit differently...

All things considered, I recommend this game, but I would highly suggest waiting for a sale.

28322335.review: This game is just amazing! An adorable shooter with a chiptune soundtrack, and old-school graphics hareking all the way back to the C64. A new feature in this sequel is that you can now take people with you on a date, and your special attack will change depending on who you bring!

This game you do have to buy, but it is definitely worth the price-- especially for fans of the original. The original game is on steam and free, so give it a try. You won't be dissappointed!

9/10

I previously stated that I didn't think the original remedy had almost any major flaws or motifs for nitpicks on it... well I was surprised to find out that this game fixed said issues, which ones? I don't know!?, progression and momentum feels stronger, there's more bosses, more tech skill, its slightly longer, added a dating system. im so glad we at least got these 2 gems for 2016 considering how underwhelming the entire year was. my favorite thing about this game though? was the return and addition of a trading card of my favorite character. apathetic frog. on a last thought as well as speaking of which.

26498361.review:
I love this game so much, it has the quirky humor and a little bit of the visual aesthetic of Undertale, but delivers a completely different type of RPG. The normal difficulty mode is just challenging enough to keep players interested but not so challenging that it would scare away casual gamers. The other two difficulty modes are quite fun and hard as heck, but still achievable.
I beat the game 102% on hard mode after a play-through on normal mode. The difference in the difficulties is clever, it doesn't make it harder by just putting more enemies on the map or making their shots stronger. It changes aspects of each enemy or boss and adds different types of projectile to dodge.
This game is very funny and made me want to keep playing because I wanted to read the next textbox. The story is very plain and simple, but it is easily overshadowed by the game play and characters.
I highly recommend this game and if you don't want to spend any money, get the first game. It is free.

26483352.review:
A great sequel that takes what made the original so charming and fun and adds new layers to it, with new abilities that mix seamlessly with the old bullet hell gameplay and other improvements like the inclusion of area bosses.

Also, you can date a door, so that's pretty cool.

26408575.review:
This game is pretty fun, too bad it's pretty short, The music's pretty good and I like how the game looks, pretty retro and all, If there will be another game, I will most likely buy it...but I guess we don't really know, If there will be a third game for the series. 

10/10 :D Never had this much fun with games along with Payday 2 and Hotline Miami.

26346390.review: I loved Princess Remedy In a World of Hurt and was so excited when they released this prequel that I bought it immediately. The game hasn't changed much gameplay or visual wise other than some new combat features that were added. I felt like this game was much shorter than the original but maybe that's just me. I would definetely recommend this game. It's cute, cheap and easy to get into to.

26338805.review: I enjoy this game. It lived up to the potential of the first game, Princess Remedy in a World of Hurt, and it was worth the wait. I highly recommend this game. You get to date characters in the game and they help you with power-ups, special attacks, etc.

26331195.review:
Una bien merecida secuela del primer juego, que si bien era gratis, éste ya es pago. El precio se justifica muchisimo ya que es considerablemente bajo y ademas tiene algunas nuevas mecánicas y mejoras al respecto.
Lo primero más importante es que existe la posibilidad de elegir como acompañante a cualquier personaje del juego, lo que hará que cambie tu habilidad especial y eso genere más variedad a la hora de jugar el modo de curacion.
La segunda gran novedad es que al desbloquear los caminos hacia otros mundos primero hay que kuchar contra mini-jefes, otro gran agregado que le da más salsa a esta secuela.
Despues hay otros detalles como que los controles estan más pulidos. El resto sigue siendo igual, manteniendo la esencia y ternura del primero.
Incluye un super secreto que a muchos seguidores de los juegos FPS les agradará :). Y algunas otras sorpresas por ahi.
Lo único criticable es que es muy corto al igual que su antecesor, o sea que en aproximadamente una hora lo terminas al casi 100%. Esperaba que éste fuese un poco mas extenso, pero bueno.
En fin, si te gustó el primer Princess Remedy tendrás 3 dolares totalmente bien invertidos. Y si por casualidad todavia no lo has jugado, puedes probarlo cuando quieras ya que como mencioné al principio es totalmente F2P.

26328047.review:
[h1]Introduction[/h1]
Princess Remedy In A Heap of Trouble was developed and published by Ludosity and is a bullet hell, RPG type game. It is fairly short, but sweet game with a nice variety of enemies & abilities. If you're skeptical about buying this, go try out there other game [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/407900/?snr=1_7_7_230_150_1][b]Princess Remedy in a World of Hurt[/b][/url] which has all the basic mechanics as this game.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Princess Remedy In A Heap of Trouble is a great retro, RPG game that has a unique gameplay style. The game is focused upon a young girl (Princess Remedy) who is trained to heal those who are hurt, and what a surprise that pretty much everyone in the world that she is in is hurt. Your objective is to heal all of those who are hurt in the world and to bring back peace to the world.

So first off lets talk about the main gameplay of the game and how you heal those who are in need. The way that you help these people is simple, talk to those who are in need and then defeat the enemies that are inside them... I'm guess their inside their mind or something but the game doesn't really clarify that. Defeating these enemies will heal the person and make them feel healthy again. It's not hard to tell that this is a different kind of RPG, which doesn't focus on the generic turn based battles but more of a kind of fast bullet hell style at times. You attack these enemies with pills that you shoot.

There is a nice variety of different kind of battle areas that you will come across when you are in battle, most if not all of the people have their own different battle areas. This makes for a nice variety of gameplay and the way that you handle the certain types of enemies that you may come across. As well as a nice variety of battle areas, you are also welcomed with a decent amount of enemies. Some of these enemies will just walk around not shooting, while others will constantly follow you and try to shoot at you. Needless to say you will have to adapt to your situation when battling.

When you heal these people they don't instantly become neglected throughout the game, you are able to bring them along with you. Now why would you do this? Well, each person that you heal has a special ability that you can use while defeating enemies and healing even more people throughout the game. The special ability can range from shooting faster to healing yourself, it seems that there is a decent amount of special abilities to choose from throughout playing the game.

As well as defeating normal enemies there are also a few bosses that you encounter before you move into a new area. These bosses are a nice break up from the regular enemies that you encounter because they have all have different fighting strategies that you will have to adapt to and defeat them.

It's probably also worth mentioning that the game is pretty short and only lasts about 1.5-2 (playing on the easiest difficulty and collecting everything) and the game tries to make up for that with 3 different difficulties. Unfortunately, the difficulties are just sped up versions of the same game, a little disappointing but still overall a decent little game.

One last quirky neat feature that I enjoyed was at the end of the game you could bring along any person that you had healed and take them on a date. It then brings you to like a guitar hero like mini game where you have to match the arrow keys. A nice little feature to end the game on.

I do love the graphics of the game, I have always loved more older retro games graphics they just seem to appealing to me. Although I do enjoy the graphics of this game, with their simplistic retro styled game I do feel like a little bit more time could've been put into them. For example, it is clear at times that your character is a single square with a single colour around your character and not transparent around your character. That's only a small thing about the game that I think could be slightly improved.

[h1]Pros[/h1]
+ A nice different kind of battling style
+ A variety of battle areas & enemies
+ Nice variety of special abilities
+ Generally great Retro styled graphics
+ Short (1.5+ hours) and sweet game
+ A nice & quirky ending

[h1]Cons[/h1]
- Graphics seem to be coloured all around the square your character is in and not transparent
- The difficulties only increase the games speed to make it harder

[h1]Result / Final Thoughts[/h1]
Overall, this game is great a real Gem when it comes to retro styled bullet hell games. Although the game is short, it's well worth the price and you might even find yourself playing through the game multiple times. If you still feel skeptical about this game, then check out their other version of this game called [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/407900/?snr=1_7_7_230_150_1][b]Princess Remedy in a World of Hurt[/b][/url]. If you enjoyed that one then you will enjoy this one.

[b]Rating: 8.9/10[/b]

[quote]For more reviews on a wide range of games, go and follow [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/LotsOGiveaways]Lot's O Giveaway's[/url] curator group [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/LotsOGiveaways#curation]here[/url]. Also, feel free to check out my [url=https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCZnoW6jbcKfQttUSJ-R2ReA][b]youtube channel[/b][/url] if you have the time to. Whether you do or don't, thanks for reading my review.[/quote]

26324896.review: A very cute game but very short. Just consider the cost of this game as half the cost of it's predecessor.

26250750.review: An excellent little game that improves upon it's predecessor in quite a few ways.  The addition of the ability to date people and obtain new flask powers is fun, and makes gameplay more vairied. The music and graphics are very pretty as well, with an alternate little song available for each different ending. I definately reccomend you buy this game if you enjoyed its free predecessor, as you won't regret it.

26191959.review:
If you haven't checked out the first Princess Remedy game, go ahead and do that. It's free. I'll wait. 

Okay, did you enjoy that? Well here is some more of the same! Combination of RPG and bullet hell shooter, just-right difficulty, an absurd sense of humor, and way way oldschool graphics and sound. Definitely worth the money although I am slightly partial to the original. 

Negatives: None really, except that it's not that much different.

26176777.review:
Have you played Princess Remedy in a World of Hurt? If not, go play that first. When you're done, come try this out. It's a bit shorter, but there's multiple boss battles now and you now pick a dating partner to bring with you that changes how your flask button works. It's pretty neat. The graphics are just a bit more artistic with the two-color per tile segment artstyle, which is also nice. And there's some new bullet types that keep things interesting.

On the downside, A Heap of Trouble feels a lot shorter, and now the shot powerups come specifically only from the bosses making it feel more like you're being gated rather than letting you explore and rewarding you for it. The dating system is interesting, but some flask types are definitely more useful than others. The writing also didn't feel as fun as the Wash-Olaf joke was omnipresent and run into the ground until it was fine specs of sand. And while the boss battles were interesting, there wasn't as much exploration with the normal battle enemy types and it just felt like there should've been more fights to really get some interesting stuff like A World of Hurt did.

My final thought is that overall A Heap of Trouble has the quality of a free game while A World of Hurt is worth the $3. The gameplay is just as fun though, so if you enjoyed A World of Hurt you definitely should pick up A Heap of Trouble.

26153866.review: This was a fun little bullet hell, 102% completion bonus was kind of disappointing but at least we got to see some familiar faces.

26082327.review: Honestly some of the most fun gameplay and ridiculously witty writing I've experienced in a while. Simple, charming, fun. It's 3 bucks. It takes an hour. Just buy it already, these guys deserve it & you will not regret it.

26061078.review: already loved the first game, but this is like an ultra deluxe version. highly recommendable, even if some healings are difficult.

26058036.review:
I wasn't the biggest fan of the first Princess Remedy game, but I'm glad she was given a second chance. A Heap of Trouble improves on the originals formula in basically every way imaginable, with the additional boss fights and customizable special attacks in particular adding a lot more variety to the encounters.

It's on the short side though, only being an hour long or so for a single playthrough even if you're going for a completionist run, so be wary of that if you're looking for something a bit meatier.

26007265.review: Princess Remedy is a short but incredibly fun game.  There is a free Princess Remedy game on Steam, and this one is more of the same (it feels a bit more polished, in my opinion).  Both games are hidden gems.

25927120.review:
[h1]La santé avant tout ![/h1]

Docteur Remedy est de retour dans cette nouvelle aventure qui raconte le passé de ce médecin au grand coeur au temps où elle était en formation de Médecine à l'école de Saturian Healing School !

Alors en soit, il n'y à pas beaucoup de changement par rapport au 1er épisode qui lui, je le rappel, était gratuit ... les graphismes sont toujours du style MS-DOS mais en un peu + coloré mais reste toutefois encore trop simpliste. La manière de joué n'a pas été retouché mis à part que nous pouvons maintenant recruté des alliés pour avoir toute sorte de pouvoirs et la possibilité de courir sur la map ! Petite parenthèse pour également signalé la présence de boss à chaque monde visité !

Il reste, encore une fois trop court mais toujours aussi plaisant à joué !

[b]Les + :[/b]
- L'ajout de boss
- Le gameplay toujours aussi sympa
- L'univers médical au grand coeur
- La possibilité de recruté des alliés

[b]Les - :[/b]
- Peu de nouveauté
- Graphismes presque inchangé
- Durée de vie encore trop courte
- Pas de gratuité cet fois-çi ?

[u]Note : 15/20[/u]

25913486.review:
Very similar to the first game, which was free, and I would definitely say I don't mind paying the fairly cheap price. In this game, the Princess is still romantically attracted to virtually everything in existence, but she's dating them to decide what special she gets during battle, as well as a fun scene at the end.

To those who don't know the original, this is an RPG with a battle mechanic like a bullet hell shooter that is supposed to represent 'healing' people by shooting the bejezus out of the physical embodiments of their problems, which sometimes aren't medical problems because this game is weird. Shooting happens automatically in the direction you're pointing, you move around a small arena with obstacles, you have a special power activated by virtually any button that has limited uses and depends on which NPC you are dating. There are bosses that mostly feel more like traditional shooter bosses and also freak me the hell out, causing me to shoot them even more enthusiastically to make them stop existing.

The game has very retro-style graphics and gameplay. I like it because the music is upbeat and the world is brightly coloured and fun, with a science fantasy feel to it. Virtually anything, including ducks, flowers, fires and doors, is self-aware and can speak, and therefore Princess Remedi is attracted to it. The humour gets extremely meta at times. This game gets compared with Undertale a lot but it feels like its own thing. 

The game is very short with one-sentence dialogues that are usually comedic, something that can bother people but in my experience doesn't affect play. There is a large leap between difficulty modes. Personally I suck at shooters and can barely defeat the final boss [spoiler] and secret boss [/spoiler] on Medium. I also find the final boss overly creepy so keep wanting to look away, which doesn't help!

25879028.review:
Nearly identical to the first game (available for free), but the awkward romance has been weaponized. Still only takes an hour or so to complete in full, but additional difficulty levels add some reason to come back for another pass or three.
If you enjoyed the first game and would like a second helping, here it is- simple as that.

10/10

25779494.review: A stellar followup to the game jam original, Heap of Trouble reworks the original game by allowing you to swap around powerups and choose how to compliment your weaknesses in playing, so yeah, well worth the purchase if you want a quick, replayable game with a lot of variety and secrets to explore.

25762848.review:
Me: I need another good RPG, most these days just suck...

25694462.review:
A prequel to A World of Hurt, this game's got more polish compared to the original game. The game's new selling point, along with the original's shooty-dodgy affair, is a buddy (or dating) system that allows you to bring most of anyone in the game you've healed along for a ride. Some'll heal you, some'll give homing shots, others will give lasers!

The music's pretty decent, aiming to match the intentionally-retro graphics. Whether or not it's accurate is up for the Commodore enthusiasts to decide. Personally, I liked it.

One of the things I [i]didn't[/i] like (and this is very much a minor thing) is that changing direction makes you change fire direction. This makes fighting the infections a little more difficult when dealing with chasers.

However, the introduction of multiple boss fights is very much welcome. Whilst A World of Hurt had one big boss at the end of the game, A Heap of Trouble has many smaller bosses as gate-keepers, whose fights dip their grotesque feet into the stream of bullet hell. Coupled with three difficulty modes (as Remar is wont to do with games he helps develop), A Heap of Trouble is definitely worth the pocket-change asking price Ludosity have placed on the game.

25684248.review: Marrying your mom is no longer possible but it's a step up from the first game in every way without losing its charm

25683190.review: Your first playthrough will be about 1 to 1.5 hours long. There's probably more to do after that, but even for one playthrough it's fun. Play the other Princess Remedy first, it's free. Then buy this one if you want more.

25680620.review: Worth the price, as cute as the previous game with a lot more in it.

25626959.review: Short, but sweet. If you enjoyed the first Princess Remedy game (and if you haven't tried it, go ahead and do so, it's free!), you'll enjoy this too! Meet a variety of colorful characters, help them feel better, and then date them! What's not to love?

25597989.review:
Fine game!
Very hard on death mode, just finished, man almost broke the controller.
Although I think the heal ability would be very hardly surpassed by any other.
Too many abilities too xP unecessary, i liked more the first one that was even simpler.

25587011.review:
[I]Ever wanted to date a wheeled whale and have it tag along? Now you can![/I]

I really enjoyed "Princess Remedy in a World of Hurt", and got this game as soon as I could.

For its price, I think it's worth it.

The changes (gameplay-wise) from the prequel are
~The abilities you gain by dating someone
~You don't heal automatically; you have to shoot enemies which drains their health.
~Area Bosses

Overall, it's a noticeable improvement, both in graphics and gameplay. The world is more animated and colourful, and the enemies and attack patterns are a lot more varied. The dialogue and sprites are charming like the prequel. The change in the way you heal makes it a tad harder, as you can't heal over time by by just dodging. I enjoyed the challenge. The game also a slightly longer, as it took me more than 2 hours to complete (I had beat the original in just an hour.)

P.S. - If you a Touhou fan, you absolutely SHOULD get this one. The final boss's bullet hell patterns were very similar to Touhou.

25578178.review: One of my favourite franchises!! I hope there's a 3rd already in the works! :D

25576182.review:
Noticeably improved over 'World of Hurt'. The core is the same, but being able to date literally anyone (a door, for example) for their abilities adds thematic and gameplay flavor, and Normal difficulty is less of a snoozefest. It's like one hour longer than 'World of Hurt', which could be beaten in less than an hour on the first playthrough, and there's a free OST on Soundcloud, so that's cool.
However, when I was playing with a XB1 controller, I found that occasionally, the game would have 'sticky' inputs; that is, when I pressed a direction for a quick tap, it would hold that direction for a second longer than I wanted. This has caused me to eat a bullet I could have dodged more than once.

8/10 it's still a shit game and a friend had to gift this to me before I would look at it

25557943.review:
Una excelente segunda parte (la cuál realmente es una precuela) de un excelente juego.
El esquema de controles ahora está mucho mejor definido, usando distintos botones para cada acción.
Siguiendo la línea del juego anterior, en el cuál [spoiler] Remedy puede casarse con cualquier personaje que ella desee [/spoiler], Remedy puede elegir a un consorte que la acompañe en su aventura. Cada acompañante altera la habilidad del botón de acción en combate. Por lo cuál permite una infinidad de variables en combate.
Ahora cada sección a desbloquear posee un poderoso jefe para poner a prueba tus habilidades.
La música es bastante entretenida, y además cada final tiene su propia melodía. [spoiler] (Sin mencionar que el final provee interactividad al estilo de DDR) [/spoiler][url=steamcommunity.com/app/522040/discussions/0/350541595106669228/] Disponible para descargar completamente gratis [/url]

[b] Bullet Hell/Shoot'em up combinado con RPG en toda su gloria, de bajos recursos y a un excelente precio.[/b]

25510187.review: I love these games. So romantic.

25487251.review:
Essentially an expansion pack to A World of Hurt, which isn't a bad thing. Still, it's more or less the exact same game, and the dating mechanic doesn't really add much-nothing other than healing was ever useful. It is sort of disappointing in having lost the novelty and originality of the first.

That said, A World of Hurt was great and totally free. 2.99 is a steal for more of the same, even if it is just more of the same.

25471079.review: Another wonderful and magical adventure with Princess Remedy! This game is wonderful just like the last one, this one may have a price tag on it, but it's completely worth it!

25470734.review: The art, the gameplay, the soundtrack. I support this game, and highly recommend it for anyone who enjoys retro gameplay!

25465473.review: Just as fun as the original. :)

25458332.review: I'm glad to see this game got a sequal. I loved the first one, and if you enjoyed the free first princess remedy then you'll enjoy this one just as much. It has the same charming classic looking graphics and same gameplay, but with a few things added in. Such as the partner system. Once you heal someone you can have them partner up with you and they can give you a different speacial move then your normal bomb throw speacial. And boss battles at every heart gate. The music is great again too. So go ahead and play the first one cause it's  free, and if you like it and want more, throw a few bucks to get this one.

25457776.review:
ALL HAIL THE MIGHTY DUCKLORD!!

For those of you who have played and enjoyed "Princess Remedy in a World of Hurt," you already have reason to get this.

For those who have not, go play the first one. IT IS FREE ON STEAM.

Then come back here when you're done. I know you'll be back in like, an hour tops, sure, but trust me on this.

THIS GAME IS WORTH ITS COST.

I mean, sure, it's more of the same, but with some nice new things to keep it all fresh, and you can date Frallan/Ducklord, so I mean, it's great. Plus you get flask abilities now, which is really cool.

So yeah, this game is worth. Get it!

25454751.review:
Just as much fun and difficult as the first free one, which I enjoyed as well! It's cute, you get to run around with the lover of your choice throughout your adventures, and it's cheap for what it gives. 

Who can say 'no' to that? :3 

Now, get out there and heal some folks!

25447643.review: Like the first game, Princess Remedy has a great gameplay and a nice, if not very detailed, story with a great sense of humor. It is definitely worth its low price.

25438772.review:
[i]...Can I date multiple people at the same time now??[/i]

[b][i]Princess Remedy In a Heap of Trouble[/i] is a fun little bullet-hell distraction with a lite level-up system.[/b] I finished it in under and hour - so keep that in mind. While I enjoyed my time, I was ok that it was over and it didn't overstay its welcome. This title has very 'lite' elements of [i]Pokemon[/i] and the bullet-hell genre. It never really gets that difficult, which was fine by me.

[b]Pros:[/b]
+Price is right, although you can finish it under and hour (84% completion for me; while I may showcase it to other people, I have little reason to play again)
+Controller support was alright (no real complaints, but sometimes it kept shooting 'down', but gameplay is forgiving enough)
+Definately is its own thing, and brings if not something new to the table - a nice collection of previously established ideas
+Music is great

[b]Cons:[/b]
-Meh, other than your companion's powerup ability, the powerups in the chests are meaningless as far as any practicality goes
-The storyline was skippable for me
-Other than the boss battles, you could just brute force through the smaller ones

[b]Totally worth three bucks, and a small afternoon.[/b]

25433955.review: Worth every penny. It doesn't stray from the feel of the first game in the slightest. It's just as much fun and has the same charm and humor, even with the added power up system. Anyone who is a fan of the ZX Spectrum will absolutely love this game. It doesn't just take graphics but has the same spirit and that is exactly how a retro themed game should feel. Music, pace, gameplay, and difficulty is all a solid 10/10.

25430306.review:
This is a lovely little sequel to a great little free jam game, that's also here on Steam and that you should also play. This is basically more of the first one, but with some fun new mechanical tweaks and more stuff to discover. 
It's short, the dialogue is fun, and the battles are bullet-hell-lite. It's not particularly hard by default, but you can crank up the difficulty OR you can skip opening chests to give yourself a real challenge.
It's absolutely worth the low price and is charming as hell so give it a shot.

25429703.review: I never thought I'd date so many people.

25425549.review:
GAY SPACE PRINCESS 2: ELECTRIC BOOGALOO

it's all the same type of shooting-them-up from the original game, but this time with added variety in the gameplay through the use of abilities gained through "dating" one NPC at a time, which replaces the flask system (although flasks work as the first game if you don't have a date).

the bosses are very interesting to see too; the first game only had one at the very end, although with some kickass music. the only thing this game was missing was some kickass boss music

overall this game is amazing and while some may say complain that it's the same length as the first in a single playthrough, i'm just glad i got to support this series as i absolutely adore it

101% completion (for those unaware):[spoiler]
[u]final final boss:[/u] after defeating the final boss and getting everything else (80 hearts, 5 power, 5 shot, 10 drain, 10 flask) take the eastern exit out of the dead garden. by the way: don't forget to look around for a hidden sign which reveals the bonus mode
  [u]jealous chest:[/u] to open the jealous chest, you must have not dated anyone before on that save file, meaning an all-flask run up to that point. it can be found in a secret area [i]within[/i] the secret area in the castle in moneyplace
[u]each is 1%, do both for 102%[/u][/spoiler]

everyone channel your energy to me so that i can defeat the other difficulty modes

25420468.review: Very similar to the first one (you can play for free), so if you liked you will like this one too. It adds new mechanics and powerups. The texts are still hilarious!

25420104.review: Princess Remedy: In a heap of trouble is a truly worthy prequel of the original. It adds so many good things to the original formula, and all of them feel so right. But, don't take my word for it, play it yourself!

38958135.review: Witty dialog and fun bosses. Excellent sequel.

39376035.review: As a fan of the first game(which is free and you should check it out first) I had to support the developers with this one and I'm glad I did. The pixel art is charming and the music is catchy but the writing is where it really shines. There's some really funny dialogue written here. The gameplay is like an auto-shooter and dating characters will grant you certain abilities that will help. It's not the hardest game(if you play on normal) but it's engaging and fun to try out new abilities. My one biggest gripe is the length. On a casual playthrough it took me less then an hour and about 20 minutes on a new game to get the "true" ending. I won't harp on that too much though as it's about the experience and the price point is fair. Overall a great game you should check out if this sort of genre interests you.
